text: (Mac User) I've setup a local environment and now need to fetch changes that were made in HubSpot since my local environment was created. I tried using what the fetch doc says "hs fetch --account=<########> </my-website-theme>[dest]" and I get this odd error "zsh: parse error near `<'" I tried every combo I could think of and finally was able to do just "hs fetch /my-website-theme" no account number if I try to add the name it says doesn't exist. So if I back out one one directory and run the bare hs fetch /file-path it overwrites it and I'm good to go unless I have made local changes. Can anyone explain to me what is happening and what are the best practices. My thought is to always push to my git for a backup (beginning of day) and always push at the end of the day and just pull and overwrite in the morning.

Hi <@U01NLJDQM8V>,
I did hs fetch but It doesn't override my local files.
